title: Miami Vice (85 REWIND - 'The Tide')
description:
'Miami Vice' did not only have a major impact on the television industry, American culture or men's clothing style during the 80s, but also heavily influenced us when forming the band '85 REWIND'. 

Join us on a trip down memory lane alongside Don Johnson, Philip Michael Thomas, John Diehl, Olivia Brown, Edward James Olmos and guest stars such as Bruce Willis. Michael Mann and Anthony Yerkovich brought this series to life, while the soundtrack of Jan Hammer made it an immortal piece of art. 

The song is 'The Tide' from our debut album ‚ÄòMagic Hour‚Äô, that you can find on all major streaming platforms:

title: Miami Vice Theme HD
description:
Miami Vice Theme HD

The adventures of the vice squad detectives of the Miami Police Department.

Stubble-faced detective Crockett lived in a sailboat guarded by his alligator Elvis. His partner Tubbs was a black New York cop looking for his brother's killer. Together they took on the Florida drug world. The show influenced men's fashions toward Italo-casual and interior decor toward the Memphis look. Very trendy music and unusual guest performers.

Creator: Anthony Yerkovich
Stars: Don Johnson, Philip Michael Thomas

title: Donzi Miami Vice Trailer and Promo - Jay Z & Linkin Park Numb Encore
description: Miami Vice Donzi trailer and Donzi Promotional Music Video... Through a special agreement with Universal Studios and director Michael Mann, Donzi Marine was proclaimed the Official Boat of Miami Vice. three Donzi boat models were featured in the film: a 38 ZF, a 38 ZR (Black), and a 43 ZR (Blue). Prior to the movies release, Donzi boats launched an ambitious media campaign touting its involvement in Miami Vice. Donzis Miami Vice ads ran in all major boating publications, and Donzi boats made headlines in USA Today, the Baltimore Sun, the Miami Herald, and several boating magazines.

title: Steve Jones Mercy-Miami Vice
Miami Vice - all night long cover
description: This is a clip from the first episode of Miami Vice,, Brother's Keeper.  The house band is doing a cover of Lionel Richie's All Night Long.  Tubb's faces his brother's killer, Calderone.  This scene typifies the Miami environment in the mid-80s.  Cocaine was rampant and Miami was a major cocaine hub.  Along with all the black market-related violence came a vast amount of wealth that helped to rebuild and vitalize the aging Miami cityscape and club scene.

üå¥üé∂ Miami Vice (1984) non √® solo una serie TV: √® un‚Äôicona culturale degli anni ‚Äô80. Con il suo stile elegante, le auto sportive, le atmosfere notturne di Miami e una colonna sonora leggendaria, ha rivoluzionato il genere poliziesco in televisione.

La serie segue i detective Sonny Crockett (Don Johnson) e Ricardo Tubbs (Philip Michael Thomas) nella loro lotta contro il crimine organizzato, tra azione, intrighi e glamour.

title: Miami Vice 1984 Cast Then and Now 2022 How They Changed
description:
Miami Vice 1984 Cast Then and Now 2022 How They Changed

Miami Vice is an American crime drama television series created by Anthony Yerkovich and produced by Michael Mann for NBC. The series stars Don Johnson as James "Sonny" Crockett and Philip Michael Thomas as Ricardo "Rico" Tubbs, two Metro-Dade Police Department detectives working undercover in Miami. The series ran for five seasons on NBC from 1984 to 1989. The USA Network began airing reruns in 1988 and broadcast an originally unaired episode during its syndication run of the series on January 25, 1990.

title: Rebel Ridge‚Äôs Don Johnson Has a Plan to Return to Miami Vice
description:
Loaded with unequivocal success, award-winning actor Don Johnson‚Äôs career is filled equally with stone-cold classics and contemporary blockbusters. He won a Golden Globe for his iconic portrayal of Sonny Crockett in Miami Vice. He‚Äôs had a top Billboard single off of his charting album Heartbeat. He lit the stage as Guys & Dolls‚Äô Nathan Detroit in London‚Äôs prestigious West End. He smashed onto the scene with a second seminal television show, Nash Bridges. He‚Äôs filmed fruitful collaborations with massive directors like Quentin Tarantino, Robert Rodriguez, Rian Johnson, and so many more. Now he‚Äôs adding Rebel Ridge, the new film by Blue Ruin‚Äôs thriller auteur filmmaker Jeremy Saulnier, to his filmography.

Rebel Ridge is set in the town of Shelby Springs. After Terry Richmond (Aaron Pierre) tries to post bail for his cousin, his savings are unjustly seized by corrupt local police Chief Sandy Burnne, played with pitch-perfect intensity by Johnson. With the help of court clerk Summer McBride (AnnaSophia Robb), Terry unearths a widespread conspiracy within Shelby Springs and sets off to get his money back by any means necessary.

Collider‚Äôs Steven Weintraub sat down with Don Johnson to discuss humanity in villains, what it‚Äôs like rehearsing with Oscar-winning directors, and the reality of shooting over 20 episodes of Miami Vice each season.

#donjohnson #rebelridge #aaronpierre

title: Don Johnson (Miami Vice)  on Fame, Fans, and Future Goals | Exclusive 1989 Chat on Countdown
description:
TV Interview with actor and singer Don Johnson on Dutch popshow ‚ÄúCountdown‚Äù.  
In this 1989 interview, Don Johnson sits down with Wessel to talk about his experiences with devoted fans, his views on climate issues, and the goals he‚Äôs still working toward. He also shares details about his latest music project and reflects on life during the height of his Miami Vice fame. 

The television show Countdown was broadcasted by Veronica from 1976 to 1993 and was "Europe's Number 1 Rock Show" with performances by the greatest artists from all over the world like Paul McCartney, David Bowie, Tina Turner, Janet Jackson, Stevie Wonder, The Rolling Stones, George Harrison, U2, The Police, Eric Clapton, Bruce Springsteen, Lenny Kravitz, Depeche Mode, New Order, Whitney Houston, Duran Duran, R.E.M., Frankie Goes To Hollywood, The Cure, Run DMC, Cyndi Lauper, Iron Maiden, New Kids On The Block, LL Cool J.

 ‚Ä¢ Subscribe to our channel: https://bit.ly/3kepHLP


‚Ä¢ Playlist 70's Countdown clips: https://bit.ly/3bBwY4L
‚Ä¢ Playlist 80's Countdown clips: https://bit.ly/3qVyKE5
‚Ä¢ Playlist 90's Countdown clips: https://bit.ly/3kmXiUf
‚Ä¢ Playlist met Nederlandstalige acts bij Countdown: https://bit.ly/3qJ0NFQ

Countdown has been owned since 2016 by the American company Reelin‚Äô In The Years Productions & the Dutch company Double 2 BV. The Countdown archive contains thousands of unique musical performances, interviews and concert appearances by the greatest rock, R&B, pop, new wave and rap/hip-hop artists of the era. The archive is fully digitized and catalogued and is available for licensing to all forms of media worldwide.

For licensing inquiries please contact David Peck - https://reelinintheyears.com/ and for business within the Benelux countries please contact Jan Douwe Kroeske - http://www.double2bv.nl Please note that we do not supply our material to fans, collectors, or other private entities and will only send material out for legitimate projects to clients in the entertainment industry.


====
OVER COUNTDOWN
====
Het Nederlandse televisieprogramma "Countdown" was van 1976 t/m 1993 ‚ÄúEurope‚Äôs Number 1 Rock Show‚Äù en werd uitgezonden bij Veronica. Later werd het programma ook uitgezonden in het buitenland en was het op z'n hoogtepunt in meer dan 20 landen op televisie te zien.

Gedurende deze 17 jaar muziekgeschiedenis zijn er opnames gemaakt met talloze internationale sterren, zoals Paul McCartney, David Bowie, Tina Turner, Janet Jackson, Stevie Wonder, The Rolling Stones, George Harrison, U2, The Police, Eric Clapton, Bruce Springsteen, Lenny Kravitz, Depeche Mode, New Order, Whitney Houston, Duran Duran, R.E.M., Frankie Goes To Hollywood, The Cure, Run DMC, Cyndi Lauper, Iron Maiden, New Kids On The Block, LL Cool J.

Uiteraard kwamen Nederlandse top-acts als Doe Maar, Andre Hazes, Herman Brood, Frank Boeijen, Spargo, Golden Earring, Time Bandits,  De Dijk, De Raggende Manne, Hans de Booij, Gerard Joling, Drukwerk ook langs voor een optreden in Bussum.

Countdown werd gepresenteerd door oa Lex Harding, Erik de Zwart, Adam Curry, Simone Walraven Wessel van Diepen, Jeroen van Inkel, Rob Stenders, Simone Angel en Jasper Faber.

Het Countdown archief is vrijwel helemaal compleet en sinds 2017 eigendom van het Amerikaanse Reelin‚Äô In The Years Productions (David Peck - https://reelinintheyears.com/) en Double 2 Hilversum (Jan Douwe Kroeske - http://www.double2bv.nl). Het archief bestaat uit meer dan 3.000 analoge mastertapes die allemaal gedigitaliseerd en gearchiveerd zijn. Indien u gebruik wilt maken van beeldmateriaal in een documentaire, tv-programma of andere mediaproductie neemt u voor een licentiedeal contact op met Double 2 BV via info@d2bv.nl. Beeldmateriaal wordt enkel verstrekt aan zakelijke projecten en niet aan particulieren.

title: Miami Vice: Andy Taylor - When The Rain Comes Down (full scene with setup)
description:
From Miami Vice Season 3, Episode 2: Stone's War

Song starts at 0:44

This episode is special in that it features Sonny's new ride, a 1986 Ferrari Testarossa (my personal favorite) after his previous "Ferrari" (was actually a Corvette with a body kit) was destroyed with a Stinger missile. You know, like typically happens every day üòÜ. That means this is the first REAL Ferrari Sonny drives on a regular basis. If you're wondering why that is... it's because it took Ferrari 3 years to realize what a hit the show was and since they were already driving a pseudo-Ferrari, the company thought it best to provide them with a real one for promotional reasons. You can guarantee there were cars sold because of that move.

Another fun fact about this scene is it features the song "When The Rain Comes Down" by Andy Taylor, which was recorded exclusively for Miami Vice and was only available on the soundtrack titled "Miami Vice II" which featured a number of songs from the show. You may know Andy Taylor from the hit 80s group Duran Duran. After leaving the group in 1986, he began working on a solo career. This song proceeds his first solo album "Thunder" which released in 1987.

As for why I uploaded this video to my channel... I basically just really like the car and the driving footage but I also noticed a lack of the video with the original scene on YouTube and figured I'd add it. I don't own the rights to the song or video beyond my own personal purchase of the DVD. This video is not made for profit. Just entertainment. Thanks for watching.

#MiamiVice #AndyTaylor #WhenTheRainComesDown

title: Miami Vice üï∂Ô∏èüòé #cocktails #pinacolada #strawberrydaiquiri
Federico Buffa Racconta Miami Vice
description:
C‚Äô√® chi dice che gli anni ‚Äô80 sono diventati gli anni ‚Äô80 solo quando la colonna sonora di ‚ÄúIn The Air Tonight‚Äù di Phil Collins ha iniziato ad accompagnare Crockett (Don Johnson) e il suo partner Tubbs (Philip Michael Thomas) nelle loro avventure notturne per le strade di Miami. C‚Äô√® da crederci. In onda per la prima volta sul network NBC il 16 settembre 1984 (il venerd√¨ sera in prima serata, in concorrenza diretta con Falcon Crest), l‚Äôavvento di ‚ÄúMiami Vice‚Äù cambia per sempre il modo di fare televisione. Solo un anno dopo, infatti, i due poliziotti sono gi√† sulla copertina di TIME e il titolo ‚Äì ‚ÄúCool Cops, Hot Show‚Äù ‚Äì sancisce il successo della serie. Fondamentali alcuni ingredienti: la centralit√† del tema musicale (affidato ad artisti di grande successo, da Phil Collins ai Dire Straits, e per la prima volta trasmesso in TV in stereo), l‚Äôuso quasi esclusivo dei colori pastello (nessun colore di terra), un nuovo stile nel vestire (Macy‚Äôs ospita nei propri negozi corner di abbigliamento ispirati al telefilm) e in pi√π tutto il sex appeal di un Don Johnson al massimo della sua fama. Saranno in tutto 111 episodi, che da quel settembre 1984 saranno trasmessi fino al 1989, ma l‚Äôeredit√† di Miami Vice rimane ancora oggi fortissima.

There are those that say that the '80s only really became the '80s when the soundtrack of ‚ÄúIn The Air Tonight‚Äù by Phil Collins began to accompany Crockett (Don Johnson) and his partner Tubbs (Philip Michael Thomas) on their night-time adventures on the streets of Miami. It's not such a far-fetched idea. Broadcast for the first time on the NBC network on the 16th of September 1984 (primetime on Friday evening, in direct competition with Falcon Crest), the advent of Miami Vice changed television forever. Just one year later the two police officers were already on the cover of TIME, under the title ‚ÄúCool Cops, Hot Show‚Äù, sanctioning the series' success. Fundamental ingredients of the show: the central role played by the theme music (played by highly successful musicians, from Phil Collins to Dire Straits, and broadcast in stereo for television for the first time), the almost exclusive use of pastel colours (no earth tones), a new way of dressing (Macy‚Äôs dedicated special corners in its stores to clothing inspired by the series) and above all the sex appeal of Don Johnson at the height of his fame. The series may have stopped at 111 episodes, running from that September in 1984 until 1989, but the legacy of Miami Vice is still strong even today.

title: 12 Beloved Miami Vice Actors Who Tragically Passed Away
description:
12 Beloved Miami Vice Actors Who Tragically Passed Away
Miami Vice was a groundbreaking TV series that captured the spirit of the 1980s with its stylish visuals, cutting-edge music, and gripping crime stories. The show‚Äôs stars became icons, known for their charisma and unforgettable performances that helped define a decade. But behind the glitz and glam, several of these talented actors have sadly passed away‚Äîsome after long illnesses, others under sudden or tragic circumstances. In this video, we take a heartfelt look back at the lives and careers of the Miami Vice cast members we lost, exploring their contributions to the show and the lasting legacy they left behind. Join us as we honor these unforgettable stars who helped make Miami Vice a television classic.

title: Jan Hammer - Miami Vice - Crockett's Theme [Re-Extended & Remastered by Gilles Nuytens]
description:
Jan Hammer - Crockett's Theme (Miami Vice) [Remastered & Re-Extended by Gilles Nuytens]

This is a remastered and "re-extended" version of the famous ¬´ Crockett's Theme ¬ª from the TV show "Miami Vice" by Jan Hammer (1986). Re-Extended because it has already been officially extended for the 12'' vinyl. However the official extended version was "only" 5'50''. So, I did more... It's been remastered from the original vinyl in ultra high quality (24bits/192khz). The original rip was riddled with cracks and hiss and it took me a while to clean it up. It's not a loop! I really worked it to make it sound like an original composition.

Check also my other extended mixes: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL3go_qa80u3bjCnykAb-kpKo1Gvn4YKM0

If you like this, please, subscribe, like, share.

Legal notes: I do not own this music! All rights remain to Jan Hammer.

*Welcome to the Official YouTube Channel of Hollywood Guns*

This channel is dedicated to providing in-depth analysis and detailed explorations of the guns that have not only shaped cinematic moments but have also influenced firearm culture across the globe. We are passionate about uncovering the stories behind the most iconic guns featured in action movies and thrillers, particularly from the golden era of the late 20th century. Each video on our channel dives into the design, history, and on-screen legacy of firearms from blockbuster hits and beloved TV shows. Our mission is to become the premier video resource for movie gun enthusiasts, collectors, and anyone fascinated by the intersection of filmmaking and firearm technology.
Join us as we dissect how these weapons were chosen by directors and prop masters to enhance storytelling, contribute to character development, and bring authenticity to some of the most memorable scenes in film history. 
‚û°Ô∏è From the rifles echoing through war films to the shotguns and pistols that have defined the action sequences of classic thrillers, Hollywood Guns covers them all with precision and expert insight. We offer comparisons between the cinematic portrayals of these firearms and their real-world specifications, providing a unique perspective that appeals to both movie fans and gun aficionados alike. Learn about the dual roles these firearms play as both practical tools and powerful symbols within narratives. Discover the tactical functionalities that make these guns favorites among military and law enforcement and see how accurately films represent their capabilities. We also delve into behind-the-scenes trivia, offering viewers a peek into how movie magic is made. Enjoy engaging episodes that speculate on the future appearances of vintage guns and explore the resurgence of classic firearms in modern cinema.

title: Jan Hammer - Crockett's Theme (Miami Vice)
description:
Miami Vice is an American crime drama television series created by Anthony Yerkovich and produced by Michael Mann for NBC. The series stars Don Johnson as James "Sonny" Crockett and Philip Michael Thomas as Ricardo "Rico" Tubbs, two Metro-Dade Police Department detectives working undercover in Miami. The series ran for five seasons on NBC from 1984 to 1989. The USA Network began airing reruns in 1988 and broadcast a previously unaired episode during its syndication run of the series on January 25, 1990.

Unlike standard police procedurals, the show drew heavily upon 1980s New Wave culture and is noted for its integration of contemporary pop and rock music and stylish or stylized visuals. People magazine states that Miami Vice was the "first show to look really new and different since color TV was invented".

Michael Mann directed a film adaptation of the series, which was released July 28, 2006.

title: Miami Vice Documentary | The Inspiration Behind Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, Hotline Miami & Outrun
description:
What do Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, Ferraris, designer stubble, outrun, synthwave, retrowave, and the '80s renaissance have in common? Two words: Miami Vice. So in-between watching GTA 6 trailer breakdowns, why not learn how this stylish police procedural spread its vast influence echoes across our culture, entertainment and civilization for decades? From Grand Theft Auto: Vice City and Vice City Stories, Hotline Miami, Drive (2011), Burn Notice, the Outrun movement, mallsoft music, and countless other works.

And while most only know it for white suits and funny haircuts, the show is much more than it initially lets on. And unlike most TV series, this work of fiction helped transform the Miami-Dade area from a crime-addled slum to a booming party town, famous for its music and tourism scene.

Rockstar Games also showcases the stunning Vice City in their highly anticipated Grand Theft Auto VI!

Let's delve into the cultural, societal and media influence of Miami Vice.

title: Phil Collins - In The Air Tonight - Miami Vice HQ
The Legendary Don Johnson: From Miami Vice to Hollywood Icon #donjohnson #miamivice #80sicon #actor
description:
Don Johnson is an American actor, producer, and director known for his work in film and television, particularly for his iconic role in the 1980s television series "Miami Vice." He has had a diverse and successful career spanning several decades. Here are some key highlights of his career:

Career Highlights
Early Life and Background:

Don Johnson was born on December 15, 1949, in Flat Creek, Missouri. He grew up in various places in the United States and developed an interest in acting at a young age, eventually moving to San Francisco to pursue his career.
Breakthrough Role:

Johnson achieved fame in the 1980s with his role as James "Sonny" Crockett in the television series "Miami Vice" (1984-1989). The show, known for its stylish visuals, music, and themes, became a cultural phenomenon and is considered one of the greatest TV series of all time. Johnson's portrayal of the cool, street-smart detective made him a household name.
Film Career:

In addition to television, Johnson has appeared in several films, including:
"The Hot Spot" (1990): A neo-noir film where he played the lead role alongside Virginia Madsen and Billy Wirth.
"Django Unchained" (2012): Directed by Quentin Tarantino, Johnson had a notable supporting role in this acclaimed film.
"Knives Out" (2019): He played Harlan Thrombey, a wealthy mystery writer, in this popular murder mystery film directed by Rian Johnson.
Television Roles:

Beyond "Miami Vice," Johnson has appeared in various television series, including "Nash Bridges" (1996-2001), in which he starred as an undercover cop. The show was well-received and showcased his continued appeal as a leading man in television.
Directing and Producing:

In addition to acting, Don Johnson has directed and produced several projects throughout his career, further showcasing his versatility in the entertainment industry.
Music Career:

Johnson also has a background in music and released several albums in the 1980s. One of his singles, "Heartbeat," became a hit in 1986, further establishing his influence as a multi-talented artist.
Recognition and Awards:

Over the years, Don Johnson has received various awards and nominations for his acting, including Golden Globe nominations. His role in "Miami Vice" particularly contributed to his legacy in television.
Personal Life
Don Johnson has been married several times and has children, including actress Dakota Johnson. He is known for his charismatic personality and has remained a prominent figure in entertainment.
Conclusion
Don Johnson is a talented actor whose career spans television, film, and music. He is best known for his iconic role in "Miami Vice," but his work extends far beyond that, showcasing his versatility and talent. As he continues to take on new projects, Johnson remains an influential figure in the entertainment industr

title: Why Colin Farrell Nearly Passed Out When Making Miami Vice (2006)
description:
On 27 July 2006, at the UK premiere of Miami Vice, Colin Farrell told ITN how an experience involving some undercover police officers and a supposed drug deal caused him to nearly pass out in terror. 

The Castleknock-born actor has been nominated for the Best Actor award at this year's Oscars for his role in Martin McDonagh's The Banshees of Inisherin. Farrell and co-star Brendan Gleeson worked with McDonagh previously on his 2008 black comedy, In Bruges.

description:

title: MIAMI VICE (2006) - THE BEST MOVIE YOU NEVER SAW
description:
Welcome back to another edition of The Best Movie You Never Saw. This week, we are taking a look at a more recent film, 2006‚Äôs MIAMI VICE. For those of you who know anything about me, you know my love for Michael Mann‚Äôs classic 1980s television series runs deep. The saga of Crockett and Tubbs is an instantly recognizable archive of a decade of excess, fluorescent clothing, rolled up sport coats, and amazing hair. Running for five seasons on NBC, MIAMI VICE drew heavily on New Wave culture and has remained a syndication stalwart for thirty years. Having influenced everything from video games like Grand Theft Auto: Vice City to the storytelling format of police procedurals like Law & Order, Miami Vice returned to the mainstream in the early 2000s with series creator Michael Mann behind the camera. Only, this big screen MIAMI VICE is virtually nothing like the television series it was based on - or so it would seem.

Since the lackluster box office of $63.5 million domestically (plus another $100 million internationally) and divisive critical reception, Miami Vice faded pretty quickly but the stories of the troublesome production have abounded. But how is the film itself, fifteen years after the fact? Join us as we examine this much maligned but awesome Michael Mann, Colin Farrell and Jamie Foxx classic. 


For more MOVIE NEWS, visit: http://www.joblo.com

title: Jan Hammer - Crockett's Theme (live by Kebu @ Dynamo)
description:
This cover is out now on my "Synthesizer Legends - Volume 1" album:
https://ZYXDance.lnk.to/SynthesizerLegends

The album is still available for a limited time on vinyl!
https://kebu.bandcamp.com/

I always liked this tune and was inspired when I heard Michael Cassette's version. So for my live performance I made an arrangement that was influenced by both versions, but put my own twist on it. The tune ended my show in Dynamo, Turku, where this video was recorded 5th May 2012. Unfortunately, I only had three camcorders going and the heavy bass drum in the club made the cameras vibrate with each beat. But the feeling was so high in the club that I definitely wanted to upload this particular take! 

The song was performed using only analog synthesizers, either played live or sequenced. The performance was recorded line in to one of the cameras. The ambience in the club was recorded using the built-in microphones on two of the remaining cameras and mixed together with the line signal. Some mistakes were replaced with audio from a rehearsal take.

Equipment used in this song: Korg Polysix, Poly 61 (through a SansAmp GT2), Mono/Poly, Micro-preset M500; Roland TR-808, Jomox AirBase99, Juno 60, Alpha Juno 1&2; Touched-by-sound DRM1, Oberheim Matrix 6R, Yamaha RM1x (only for MIDI sequencing), Behringer DDX3216, Lexicon MPX500, as well as a midi patchbay and additional preamps for my mixer. Cameras: Canon HF100 (x2) and HF200.

A big thank you to the amazing audience in Turku and to Turku Synth Club for arranging the gig!

WWW: 
http://kebu.fi
https://www.facebook.com/kebunator

title: Miami Vice (2006). The Story of Failure and Production Hell
description:
#movie #show #cinema #facts #actorsofinstagram 
Mann returned to the idea of a feature film in 2004 while filming Collateral. After a successful collaboration with Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx, Mann offered them the lead roles in Miami Vice. Both actors agreed, quickly signed contracts, and started working with Mann on the script. However, a few months later, Tom Cruise left the project to work on Mission: Impossible III, which offered him a much bigger paycheck. Jamie Foxx stayed, which later led to some unfortunate consequences.

title: Miami Vice Intro (GTA Vice City theme)
Don Johnson celebrates Miami Vice at 40
description:
On the 40th anniversary of Miami Vice‚Äôs television debut, star Don ‚ÄúSonny Crockett‚Äù Johnson calls the impact on his life‚Äîand cinema and TV history ever since‚Äî‚Äúprofound‚Äù. 

Created by Anthony Yerkovich and produced by Michael Mann for NBC, Miami Vice debuted on NBC on 16 September 1984 and ran for five seasons until 1990. The series co-starred Philip Michael Thomas as ‚ÄúTubbs‚Äù and its many featured guests included Pam Grier, Helena Bonham-Carter, Bruce Willis, Leonard Cohen, Willie Nelson, Liam Neeson, Little Richard, Ben Stiller, Sheena Easton, Barbra Streisand, Steve Buscemi and more.

Don Johnson plays Chief Sandy Burnne in Jeremy Saulnier‚Äôs latest film, Rebel Ridge, streaming on @netflix.

title: THE BEST SCENE IN MIAMI VICE
description:
Miami Vice Season 04 Episode 20 :: A Bullet for Crockett

I just finished binge watching all 5 seasons of Miami Vice. WHAT A SHOW. No idea what I've been missing. I made my own list of the top "obscure" episodes of Miami Vice: http://lopezvideo.net/blog/12/16/2017

But there's one episode that didn't make it on the list...

A Bullet for Crockett. The reason is simple: it's the 2nd worse episode in the entire show (the winner goes to "Leap of Faith"). But that INTRO scene - holy shit!

That intro scene is my #1 favorite scene in the entire season. It's got tension, fate, sex, life, death, pop, urban, nothing, everything, PERFECT! This is how you cinema. 

PS: This show is universally iconic for its use of Phil Collins's "In The Air Tonight" in its pilot episode "Brother's Keeper" (Season 01 Episode 01). But what most people don't know is that the song is used for a second time in the series... In this episode, in this scene. And in my opinion, *THIS* is the defining / iconic use of the song... Not the pseudo-romantic fragment-poem bullshit they tried to pull off in the first episode, which caught on for some reason (I guess people really love shots of cars driving at night in a neon-glowing city...)

Enjoy.

title: Miami Vice S01 E19 :: The Home Invaders
description:
Directed by Abel Ferrara. 

This is easily one of the best scenes in the entire 5 seasons of Miami Vice. 

I call this one "The Ballad of Big Data." 

It's a dramatization of Detective Castillo piecing together disparate bits of information in order to come up with a Big Data picture of a crime scene. It highlights the beauty of the information age & individual human creativity, by literally ending with the word, "beautiful."

title: Miami Vice TV Series Explored - The 80's Cop Show That Defined An Entire Generation, A Neon Dream
description:
Roll down the pastel convertible windows and crank up the Phil Collins! This video dives deep into Miami Vice, the iconic 80's cop show that pulsated with neon lights and redefined cool. We'll explore the stylish duo of Crockett and Tubbs, their undercover operations in the heart of Miami's drug scene.  Get ready for a blast from the past as we revisit the show's signature blend of action, drama, and music that captured an entire generation.  We'll analyze how Miami Vice's fashion, soundtrack, and storytelling left a lasting legacy on television and pop culture forever.

title: "You Touch Her Again, and You Won't Need a Social Worker!" | Miami Vice
description:
Castillo wants Crockett to speak to a psychologist, DiTello, but he refuses, opting instead to go to the hospital and check on the boy, Jeffrey McAllister, who is alive but not yet stabilized. Crockett insists that everything possible be done for him, and for the doctors to let him know about money if needed. Outside ICU they see Monroe, who blames his outburst on Annette "turning tricks" and that he's been seeing a social worker. Crockett warns him about touching Annette again.

From Season 4 Episode5  "Child‚Äôs Play": Crockett agonises after a weapons-smuggling probe ends in a boy's death, taking the chance to try and reconnect with his estranged son.

title: Highsmith Shoots Stevens, Claiming to Have Saved Crockett's Life | Miami Vice
description:
Castillo and the team are staked out at the meet location, but there also is a battery of Stevens' men, including Crockett and Tubbs, who stop them cold; Tubbs moves in to arrest Hawkins and Escalante, and a shootout takes place between Stevens' men that weren't arrested, Hawkins' men and SRT/Vice. Numerous rogue cops and bad guys are killed. Stevens is leaving with some drugs to continue funding his organization when Crockett moves in to arrest him. Stevens tells him the organization goes to levels he wouldn't believe; suddenly, Highsmith shoots Stevens down, claiming to have saved Crockett's life, despite his protests to the contrary. Highsmith is on TV that evening gloating about his accomplishment, which gives Crockett an idea of just how high it goes as he turns off the TV in disgust.

From Season 5 Episode 15  ‚ÄúOver the Line‚Äù: Tubbs and Crockett infiltrate a vigilante police group that risks innocent lives to dispense its own form of justice.

While Mills feels Crockett's memory lapse was "convenient", Tubbs & Castillo are firmly sided with Crockett (especially since he returned to OCB on his own accord and took down the cartels), and the neurosurgeon confirms Crockett's amnesia is consistent with the head injury he suffered.

Voices" by Russ Ballard was featured in the TV show Miami Vice, specifically in the episode titled "Calderone's Return (Part II)"
The song was released in 1984 as part of Russ Ballard's self-titled album1
It didn't make the Billboard Hot 100, but it did reach #15 on the Billboard Mainstream Rock chart.

Wanna buy the excellent Blu-ray Miami Vice set?, click here: https://amzn.to/3ZUQRhN
It's super high quality!

The song has an enigmatic and haunting quality, with Ballard describing it as being about the "voice within us" that can be either positive or negative. It's a great track that adds a lot of atmosphere to the Miami Vice episode.

When he took over as Lt. Castillo on 'Miami Vice,' Edward James Olmos had a completely different idea about playing his character. Edward James Olmos transformed the character of Lt. Castillo on ‚ÄúMiami Vice,‚Äù bringing a stark contrast to his predecessor, Lt. Rodriguez.

Discover Miami Vice on Amazon at this link: https://amzn.to/3ZUQRhN

Olmos insisted on a minimalist office for Castillo, removing all items except a bottle of aspirin, to reflect the character‚Äôs personality. Olmos and Don Johnson had a standoff over whether Castillo‚Äôs office door should be open or closed, which ultimately added to the on-screen tension.

Olmos maintained a distant demeanor towards other characters for the first 10 episodes to enhance the tension and authenticity of his role.

Ah, a classic combo of '80s electronic beats and neon-soaked crime drama!
"Pump Up the Volume" by MARRS was a groundbreaking track in 1987, blending house, hip-hop, and electronic music into a dancefloor anthem. It became a massive hit and is often credited with helping to popularize sampling in mainstream music. You can check out the official video here.
As for Miami Vice, the song was featured in the episode "Baseballs of Death", which aired on February 19, 1988. The show was famous for its stylish cinematography, pastel suits, and an iconic soundtrack that perfectly captured the '80s aesthetic.

The song ‚ÄúYou Never Listen to Me‚Äù by Peter Cetera was featured in the Miami Vice episode titled "Redemption in Blood". This episode is part of the fifth season of the series. The song appears during a scene where Burnett shoots at Tubbs and Tubbs escapes.

"You Never Listen to Me" is a song by Peter Cetera from his 1988 album "One More Story". The song features David Gilmour, the guitarist from Pink Floyd, on guitar. Here are some of the lyrics:

```
You say, "Not now, it's too late
Now's not the time, it can wait"
You never listen to me
Some things are hard to forget
It's time to do something you might regret
You never listen to me, please listen to me
I think that you must be blind
Haven't you noticed that I'm not around?
Wasting your precious time
You never listen to me, please listen to me
```

title: Miami Vice I Dire Straits I Brothers In Arms
description:
This haunting ballad underscores one of the most iconic endings in the series. As Crockett and Tubbs uncover the truth behind a vigilante ex-cop, the slow, mournful guitar of ‚ÄúBrothers in Arms‚Äù plays over a montage that‚Äôs equal parts chilling and poetic. The song‚Äôs anti-war message adds emotional weight to the episode‚Äôs themes of justice and trauma. The song was written by Mark Knopfler during the Falklands War, reflecting on the futility and tragedy of conflict.

title: Hank Weldon about his role in Miami Vice
description: Henry "Hank" Weldon is a retired detective from the Metro-Dade Vice Division, worked as a cop from 1968-1979, received numerous commendations, and looked upon as an excellent cop. In 1976 Weldon began building a case against Tony Arcaro for drug trafficking. In 1979 Arcaro was arrested, but got off on an unspecified technicality, sending Weldon into a rage, as Arcaro was his sole focus for three years. #shorts #miamivice

title: Melanie Griffith & Don Johnson shine at the 1989 Golden Globes
description:
Melanie Griffith and Don Johnson attended the 46th Annual Golden Globe Awards on January 28, 1989, at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California. Their appearance was part of a glamorous era in Hollywood, with both stars at the height of their fame.
Melanie Griffith had just won a Golden Globe for Best Actress in a Motion Picture ‚Äì Musical or Comedy for her role in Working Girl (1988), a performance that also earned her an Oscar nomination. Don Johnson, meanwhile, was riding high from his iconic role as Sonny Crockett in Miami Vice, which had cemented his status as a style and television icon.

Their joint appearances at award shows were often covered by the press, not just for their star power but also for their on-again, off-again relationship, which fascinated fans and tabloids alike. They married twice‚Äîfirst in 1976 and again in 1989, shortly after this Golden Globes event.

title: Reunion Miami Vice 2025 Trailer
description:
üï∂Ô∏è Miami Vice fans, get ready to roll up your sleeves and channel your inner Crockett and Tubbs‚Äîbecause the 2025 reunion is real, and it‚Äôs electric.

From September 9‚Äì14, South Beach is transforming into a neon-lit tribute to the iconic '80s series with the **MV41 Reunion**. Here's what‚Äôs lined up:

üé¨ Event Highlights
- Outdoor screening of the pilot episode on Ocean Drive, followed by live commentary from cast and crew
- 80s car and fashion show‚Äîmodels are being cast for that signature Don Johnson swagger and Olivia Brown sass
- Dinner experiences with cast and crew at Yuca 105
- Filming location tours, parties, karaoke, and live performances
- A massive Miami Vice museum at the Wilzig Museum Building, open through Art Basel

### üé≠ Who‚Äôs Attending?
Confirmed guests include:
- Edward James Olmos  
- Olivia Brown  
- Saundra Santiago  
- John Diehl  
- Bruce McGill  
- Ismael Carlo  
- Pepe Serna

### üéüÔ∏è Tickets & Info
Some events are free (like the fashion show), while others require tickets. You can find full details and ticket options on the official MV41 event site: https://miamiviceevents.com/.

La serie se caracteriz√≥ por su novedosa integraci√≥n de m√∫sica y efectos visuales para narrar la historia.

Esta serie es largamente recordada principalmente por las ropas elegantes que los detectives Sonny Crockett y Ricardo Tubbs vest√≠an, el sonido y los distintos efectos visuales. title: Jan Hammer - Miami Vice Theme (12" version) [MCA-23575] [Vinyl]
description:
This is a garage sale find. Got this for around 1$ (less than 1‚Ç¨). No scratches, no cracks. Just the typical 1980-85 vinyl crackling. 

Everybody heard about the TV series Miami Vice at least once, but maybe not everybody remember the main theme (including me unfortunately). This is probably the most 80's stuff I have ever listened and so is the visuals of the sleeve, with it's blue and pink lettering. Enjoy !

I suspect that the guys who made Death Rally were inspired by this song for the game's intro song.

If you like the idea of this channel, and feel free to leave your suggestions in the comments ! 

Subscribe and make me happy ! :D

FACEBOOK : https://www.facebook.com/MusiqueAnalogique
YOUTUBE : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdNL4pWAdmseAmKxJGqVsgg
INSTAGRAM : Maybe

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Artist: Jan Hammer
Album: Miami Vice Theme (12" Version)
Label: MCA Recordings - MCA-23575 - US
Released: November 1985

A. Miami Vice Theme (Extended Remix) - 0:28
B1. Miami Vice Theme (Remix) - 7:50
B2. Miami Vice Theme (Original) - 12:26

About Musique Analogique :

This channel (will) make you discover (or not) good music, old or new of any style available on this great audio support. The audio source is the direct, unmodified, unfiltered vinyl audio as it comes out from my pre-amplifier.

If you are an artist and want to promote your music here, message me.
If you are an artist/label and DON'T want your music here, message me too.

Starring Don Johnson and Philip Michael Thomas, created by Anthony Yerkovich and produced by Michael Mann, "Miami Vice" focused on the Miami Police Department's vice squad and its efforts to end drug trafficking and prostitution. Centered on the unlikely partnership of Sonny Crockett and Ricardo Tubbs - who first meet when Tubbs is undercover in a drug cartel - the series ran for five seasons on NBC, from 1984 to 1990. title: Miami Vice - The Story Of Samurai Toshin
description:
From the 8th episode of Season 2, Bushido. 
Directed by Olmos himself in his directorial debut. 
By far my favorite episode.

Though perhaps best known for the action sequence, I also liked his friendship with Jack Gretsky/Dean Stockwell. The both of them would later star together again in the re-imagined Battlestar Galactica series. 

Compiled this many years ago, a few PC's back, on windows movie maker & Fraps. Re-editing the extracted file several times resulted in a severe loss in quality, especially noticeable in the beginning. I've thought about doing it again with better capture software & shotcut, though it still remains one of my favorite edits.

Music: Jan Hammer - Russian Story

title: 20 Insane Facts About Crockett's Ferrari Testarossa From Miami Vice
description:
The white Ferrari Testarossa from Miami Vice became one of the most iconic cars in television history. But behind Crockett's sleek ride lies a treasure trove of bizarre stories, production secrets, and unexpected twists that even die-hard fans don't know.
From the legal battles that almost killed the car's TV debut to the insane modifications made for filming, the surprising stunt doubles used in action scenes, and the wild fate of the original Testarossa after the show ended‚Äîthis video uncovers 20 mind-blowing facts about the car that defined 1980s cool.
Whether you're a Miami Vice fanatic, a Ferrari enthusiast, or just love Hollywood behind-the-scenes stories, these revelations will change how you see one of TV's most legendary vehicles forever.

title: Miami Vice "Deliver Us From Evil" (BEST ENDING) April 29, 1988.
description:
The end sequence dialogue implies Crockett shot and killed an unarmed Hackman, though when Crockett walks away, there is a gun in Hackman's hand. This is possibly due to NBC censors demanding "equal arms" for both men, that Hackman (being the sneaky bad-guy he is) could have had a gun hidden under his book, or that Sonny plants the gun to make it look like Hackman committed suicide. In the scene directly preceding Hackman's death, Sonny is shown strapping a "throw away gun" to his calf under his pant leg.
Sheena Easton's final song, "Follow My Rainbow", appeared on her album The Lover In Me, released in 1989. 
Crockett's attitude in this episode, following Caitlin's death, is just like Tubbs' attitude following Angelina's death in Sons and Lovers. In both cases, they appear depressed and unwilling to listen to anyone (even their own partner). Both characters also eventually take revenge on those responsible. ..
"Deliver Us From Evil", passages from The Lord's Prayer.
When he executes Hackman, Don Johnson does not even blink in reaction to the gunshot, a very unusual thing for an actor to be able to do.
SO Hackman kills the light person and lines up his laser rifle, thinks about killing Crockett, but due to his belief that Crockett killed his wife, Hackman fires and kills Caitlin in Crockett's arms. 
Crockett, drowning his sorrows in some whiskey  surrounded by pictures of Caitlin, finds the cross Hackman gave him when he got off Death Row two years earlier, then Tubbs stops by just as Crockett gets a phone call from the M.E., which Tubbs takes, to let him know Caitlin was seven weeks pregnant (which is what she tried to tell Crockett but was never able to), which sends Crockett into a drunken rage and storms off the boat. Three weeks later, Crockett is still on the boat, cleaning & polishing everything on it (and still drowning his sorrows in whiskey), blowing off Tubbs' efforts to talk to him. Back at OCB, they found Blatt had gone back to Chicago but is returning to Miami that night, and Crockett returns to work a day early. Hackman checked into the Virgin Gordor under the name "Crockett", previously he was in Martinique. Castillo returns his transfer request, unsigned, saying he thought he'd want to review it first. Crockett & Tubbs hit Blatt's house (before he can kill Julia) and take him in. He gives up Hackman, currently on Caicos Island, though arranging extradition may be a problem. Castillo wants Crockett to get some rest, which he does, on Caicos Island where he faces Hackman. Hackman tells Crockett how he set up his retirement home, including how he made arrangements with the local judge and police about their pensions, and refuses Crockett's demands to "get up". Crockett then gives Hackman his cross back, then pulls out his gun, Hackman tells Crockett he knows how the same way he couldn't let an innocent man be executed, he knows he can't shoot an unarmed man, he then closes his eyes and lays his head back. Crockett shoots Hackman dead, and calmly walks away, and as he does we see a gun in the dead Hackman's hand. 
 "Wrong!" -- Crockett in response after killing Hackman

title: We found the original Miami Vice Ferrari in a garage
description:
Now for some, you'll know right off the bat that this was not an original Ferrari, however they were replicas of the real Ferrari Daytona Spyder. These cars were built off corvette chassis and used in the filming of Miami Vice. This particular car was used as the camera car in many of the famous driving scenes. We caught up with the owner of this car, and got the whole backstory on this amazing car. 

Thanks for watching!
00:00-03:00 - Intro
03:00-09:05 - About the car
09:05-12:10 - Scenes and Documention of the car

title: "Tribute to Jan Hammer (Miami Vice, 1984)" - Sky Division, 2024
description:
[ replaced the older version, now with the beautiful remix by Moreno J ]
Music: (Original) Jan Hammer - "Crockett's Theme" (Moreno J Remix)
Footage: "Miami Vice" scenes, compilation by Jessica C., 2019

***
[ Miami Vice, 1984 - Comment by W. M. Aslam (England) ]

Miami Vice was a hugely successful and influential TV show that would go on to be mimicked by other TV shows as well as films. Crocket and Tubbs were the coolest duo of the 80s. The look, sound, dialogue and subject matter summed up the 1980s perfectly. 
Don Johnson was cooler than ice, and Philip Michael Thomas was hotter than the Miami sun. The two men played Sonny Crockett and Ricardo Tubbs, drug-enforcement officers in a bright and fashionable Miami. At the time Miami was a run-down town, plagued with drugs as well as other social and economic problems. It‚Äôs no secret that Miami Vice helped the area prosper to eventually become what it is today. 
The show was a watershed moment in TV much like how MTV changed music and music videos. Crocket and  Tubbs took on hardened criminals and suffered for it. They showed the real side of policing, where the risk of  being harmed or even killed was an occupational hazard. What really made the show for me, was their  friendship. 
I can‚Äôt write about Miami Vice and not talk more about their pastel-shaded fashion, the stubble-faces, sock- free and carefree hairstyles. The look of Miami Vice is what made it stand out from other police shows. The  pastel colours added warmth to their personalities and complemented the Miami sunshine. The colours  popped out as did everything else in the show. The rough, unclean, dishevelled look was to Miami Vice what  Clint Eastwood was to Fistful of Dollars. 
The grooming style reminded me of that 1960s Spaghetti Western look made popular by legendary as well as visionary film director Sergio Leone. I imagine Michael Man was influenced by Leone‚Äôs anti-hero characters. The Sonny Crocket look became very popular with guys. The light-coloured blazer, pastel T-shirt and shoes without socks became commonplace. I can still remember some of my older friends wearing this look.

Miami Vice is an American television crime drama series produced by Michael Mann for NBC. The series starred Don Johnson and Philip Michael Thomas as James "Sonny" Crockett and Ricardo "Rico" Tubbs respectively, two Metro-Dade Police Department detectives working undercover in Miami. 

The series ran for five seasons on NBC from 1984--1989. The USA Network later began airing reruns the next year, in 1990, and actually broadcast an originally unaired episode during its syndication run of the series on January 25, 1990.

title: Miami Vice (1984): 20 Weird Facts You Didn‚Äôt Know!
description:
Miami Vice wasn‚Äôt just a crime drama‚Äîit was a cultural earthquake. Premiering in 1984, the show redefined television with its neon-drenched visuals, iconic fashion, and pulse-pounding soundtrack. But behind the scenes, Miami Vice was full of strange twists, risky production choices, and little-known facts that made it unlike anything else on TV.

In this video, we uncover 20 weird and fascinating facts about Miami Vice‚Äîfrom real-life crime connections and unexpected casting decisions to the show‚Äôs massive influence on music, style, and even law enforcement. Whether you're a longtime fan or just discovering Crockett and Tubbs, you won't believe what went down behind the camera.

title: Miami Vice Best Music - Billy Ocean - Caribbean Queen
description:
TEMP 02 / CHAPTER 01 - THE PRODIGAL SON

The Prodigal Son "es el episodio de estreno de la segunda temporada de Miami Vice. El episodio se estren√≥ el 27 de septiembre de 1985 y se repiti√≥ el domingo 23 de marzo de 1986.

Originalmente se transmiti√≥ como un episodio extendido de dos horas, pero a menudo se divide en dos episodios de una hora para la sindicaci√≥n.

Crockett y Tubbs se dirigen a Nueva York para rastrear a una familia de narcotraficantes colombiana que est√° matando a agentes federales, pero descubren que tienen enemigos en ambos lados de la ley.legales para liberar a un traficante de drogas y configurar al asesino de su padre.

BYLLY OCEAN - CARIBBEAN QUEEN

Caribbean Queen (No More Love on the Run) "es una canci√≥n interpretada por Billy Ocean, grabada en el √°lbum De repente en 1985. La canci√≥n apareci√≥ en el episodio de Miami Vice" The Prodigal Son ".Caribbean Queen (No m√°s amor en la carrera)" es la primera canci√≥n de la segunda temporada de Miami Vice.

Este fue el primero de los tres √©xitos de Billboard Top 10 para Billy Ocean del √°lbum Suddenly ("Suddenly" y "Loverboy" son los otros).
 El productor y coautor de la canci√≥n, Robert John "Mutt" Lange fue productor de otros artistas de la d√©cada de 1980 como Def Leppard, Foreigner, The Cars y Loverboy. Se cas√≥ con la estrella del pa√≠s Shania Twain en 1993 y tuvo un hijo, Eja en 2001. En mayo de 2008, la pareja anunci√≥ su separaci√≥n.

La canci√≥n tambi√©n apareci√≥ en el videojuego de 2006 Scarface: The World Is Yours, que contiene varios homenajes evidentes a Miami Vice (en particular, su primera y segunda temporada), incluidos los parecidos a Crockett y Tubbs que aparecen a lo largo del juego, ir√≥nicamente como un Vice aparentemente corrupto. Polic√≠as, y un yate que se parece mucho a la danza de San Vito. Tanto la pel√≠cula Scarface como el Miami Vice son considerados por muchos como la personificaci√≥n del estilo de los a√±os ochenta.

title: Top 10 Things You Never Knew About Miami Vice 1984 ü§Ø. #actor #singer #music #hollywood
Miami Vice (1984): 25 SECRETS Hidden for Decades
description:
Step back into the neon-soaked streets of 1980s Miami with this deep dive into 25 secrets behind one of television‚Äôs most iconic shows, Miami Vice. This was more than just a cop drama‚Äîit was a cultural revolution that redefined style, music, and storytelling on the small screen. From its groundbreaking visual design to its unforgettable soundtrack, the series created a unique atmosphere that drew millions of viewers each week.

In this video, we uncover the fascinating behind-the-scenes details that made Miami Vice a trailblazer. Discover how real Miami locations became part of the show‚Äôs identity, how rising stars like Julia Roberts and Chris Rock made early appearances, and why the show‚Äôs massive budget allowed it to rival Hollywood films of the era. We also explore how the partnership between Crockett and Tubbs broke television stereotypes, giving both characters equal depth and presence.

You‚Äôll learn how Miami Vice‚Äôs innovative ‚ÄúMTV-style‚Äù storytelling used music and visuals to drive emotion, why the wardrobe choices became instantly legendary, and how the creative vision of Michael Mann shaped every frame. We also reveal the real-life law enforcement advisers who ensured authenticity in everything from tactics to props, and the production challenges that came with filming on location in Miami‚Äôs heat and unpredictable weather.

Whether you‚Äôre a lifelong fan or discovering the show for the first time, this collection of 25 little-known facts will give you a new appreciation for a series that blended glamour, grit, and groundbreaking artistry. Miami Vice wasn‚Äôt just a TV show‚Äîit was a statement, and its influence can still be seen in modern television and film today. Watch now and relive the magic of one of the most stylish series ever made.
